titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Austin Strong Papers
titlestmt.author: by Molly Wheeler

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:51

did.unittitle: Austin Strong papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Austin Strong Papers contain correspondence, theater scripts, artwork, notebooks, diaries, sketchbooks, scrapbooks, photographs, photograph albums, printed material, and professional and personal papers. The papers primarily document Strong's professional work as a playwright, stage designer, theater producer, author, artist, and landscape architect. A small amount of material documents his work as a volunteer air raid warden in the 1940s.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Serendipity Books on the Adele Gutman Nathan Theatrical Collection Fund, 1996.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Austin Strong Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Austin Strong Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call numbers: Uncat Za MS 477 and Uncat Za MS 481. Vendor list is filed in Box 1.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

bioghist.head: Austin Strong (1881-1952)
bioghist.p: Austin Strong, American playwright, stage designer, theater producer, author, artist, and landscape architect. Strong was born in San Francisco on April 18, 1881 and grew up in Hawaii and Samoa, where he lived with his step-grandfather, Robert Louis Stevenson. Austin attended Wellington College in New Zealand from 1895 to 1898. He married and settled with his wife, Mary, in Nantucket, where he was well regarded for his preservation initiatives and yearly production of the Nantucket Follies. His plays include The Little Father of the Wilderness (1906), The Toymaker of Nuremberg (1907), The Pied Piper (1908), A Good Little Devil (1913), The Dragon's Claw (1914), Bunny (1916), Three Wise Fools (1918), Seventh Heaven (1922), Drums of Oude (1927), and A Play Without a Name (1928). Several of Strong's plays also became films. He died in Nantucket on September 17, 1952.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Austin Strong Papers contain correspondence, theater scripts, artwork, notebooks, diaries, sketchbooks, scrapbooks, photographs, photograph albums, printed material, and professional and personal papers. The papers primarily document Strong's professional work as a playwright, stage designer, theater producer, author, artist, and landscape architect. A small amount of material documents his work as a volunteer air raid warden in the 1940s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: I. Correspondence, 1905-1948. II. Scripts, 1903-1928. III. Artwork, 1903-1926. IV. Notebooks and Diaries, 1899-1947. V. Scrapbooks and Photographs, 1899-1951. VI. Other Papers, 1907-1946.

did.unittitle: Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vendor list is filed at the front of Box 1.

did.unittitle: Correspondence filed in alphabetized file folders

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Approximately 85 letters to Strong with approximately 20 replies. Contains theater correspondence and business matters. Correspondents include actors and producers. Accompanied by mimeograph of cast list of The Toymaker of Nuremburg .

did.unittitle: Belasco, David

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regards production of And What Happened Then? and includes letters from Percy Jordan and Western Union telegraphs. Most letters are written on Belasco Theatre letterhead.

did.unittitle: Boucicault, Dion

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regards producing Drums of Oude and written on Duke of York's letterhead.

did.unittitle: Osbourne, Lloyd

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regards seeking renewed collaboration on a play.

did.unittitle: Letters from Carl Brandt and Houghton Mifflin; letter from Strong to Gertrude Stern

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes copies of "Rochaubeau: A commemoration by the Congress of the United States of America of the services of the French Auxiliary forces in the War of Independence, 1907" and "Note: sur le general Baron Friedrich Wilhelm von Steuben, 1794"

did.unittitle: Letter from Hugh Walpole to Strong on the production of Seventh Heaven by Strong at the Booth Theatre
Scripts

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Scripts by Austin Strong and Scripts by Others

did.unittitle: Scripts by Austin Strong

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typescripts of plays written by Strong, as maintained by Strong.

did.unittitle: Bunny , bound typescript
The Dancing Master , manuscript drafts
Drums of Oude , various versions
Little Father of the Wilderness, printed version
My Lord of the Road, manuscript drafts
The Perry Melodrama , manuscript draft
Seventh Heaven, various versions
Three Wise Fools, printed versions
The Toymaker of Nuremburg , various versions
When Fortune Flatters, manuscript drafts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes empty notebooks

did.unittitle: Scripts by Others

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: All scripts by others are bound composite typescripts with portions of printed scripts mounted on the pages. Many contain handwritten and typescript notes by Strong. Strong was likely involved with the production or stage design of each.

Coquette by George Abbott and Ann Preston Bridgers

The Show-Off by George Kelly
The Silver Cord by Sidney Howard
What Every Woman Knows by J.M. Barrie
Artwork

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Items are grouped together by size, format, or other physical characteristics.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A detailed vendor list on the architectural and other drawings in boxes 11 and 12 is filed in box 11.

did.unittitle: Eleven drawings for And What Happened Then? , four drawings for Microscopia and four related watercolors for background and stage scenery

Notebooks and Diaries
Notebooks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fourteen notebooks bound in cloth or wrappers. 20-60 pages each. Notebooks contain ideas for plays; sketches, drawings and colored pictures in each. Some inserted material. Sketch of Gillett as Sherlock Holmes. No. 4 has a playlet written out with finished colored stage drawings. New York, Pairs, Bruges, London, San Francisco.
Most notebooks contain writings, notes, and sketches. Some contain mounted clippings.

did.unittitle: "Idea Book"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains notes, sketches, ideas for plays and characters

did.unittitle: "Puritan Play" notebook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains notes on Puritans for a possible play.

did.unittitle: Diary
Sketchbook
Scrapbooks and Photographs
Scrapbooks
Unbound album sheets with autograph manuscript leaves, clippings and photographs mounted. Material regards Strong's commission to design, superintend and lay out the Auckland City Park
Contains postcards and clippings from England residence; a Churchill broadside, and several original drawings
Contains clippings; reviews of his plays; poems to Strong from his father; clippings on Moonshine , Bunny , Napoleon , and Three Wise Fools , photographs and drawings
Contains 139 original drawings, most colored by Strong, usually for his own plays; My Lord of the Road , Pan , and Boomerang but also with clippings and a few photographs
Three-ring letter album, includes letters to Strong from various individuals, programs of plays and operas, sketches by Strong, clippings on Robert Louis Stevenson, photographs, and other ephemera
Photograph by J. Edward Graeme of Robert Louis Stevenson monument in San Francisco
Photograph albums
Contains 362 photographs, nearly all are not captioned. Photographs depict Austin and Mary Strong, their travels, and other individuals
Contains 21 photographs, including some snapshots and larger images of stage figures/actors, Strong, Sidney Howard, and Stewart Edward White
Photograph of several individuals, with signatures on mat
Other Papers

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged chronologically. Undated material is filed at the end of the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains professional papers relating to Strong's theatrical productions, a short story he wrote entitled "All on a Winter's Night," his Drums of Oude 's inclusion as a service text by the War Department, and his work as a landscape architect. The series also contains personal papers, including financial papers; a printed version of an article his wife wrote in Nantucket's newspaper, The Cobble ; and handbooks for his volunteer work as a New York City air warden.

did.unittitle: Royalty statements for Strong's plays

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: From Chas Frohman, Century Play, Samuel French, John Golden, and E. Marbury

did.unittitle: Financial papers filed in alphabetized file folders

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains bills and receipts for goods, services, purchases, and dues for New York City and Nantucket homes. Also contains papers relating to dividends from investments, bills and receipts, and property and taxes.
